name: createNetworkWirelessRfProfile
description: Creates new RF profile for this network

apBandSettings.description: Settings that will be enabled if selectionType is set to 'ap'.

bandOperationMode.description: Choice between 'dual', '2.4ghz' or '5ghz'. Defaults to dual.

bandSteeringEnabled.description: Steers client to most open band. Can be either true or false. Defaults to true.

bandSelectionType.description: Band selection can be set to either 'ssid' or 'ap'. This param is required on creation.

clientBalancingEnabled.description: Steers client to best available access point. Can be either true or false. Defaults to true.

channelWidth.description: Sets channel width (MHz) for 5Ghz band. Can be one of 'auto', '20', '40' or '80'. Defaults to auto.

maxPower.description: Sets max power (dBm) of 5Ghz band. Can be integer between 2 and 30. Defaults to 30.

minBitrate.description: Sets min bitrate (Mbps) of 5Ghz band. Can be one of '6', '9', '12', '18', '24', '36', '48' or '54'. Defaults to 12.

minPower.description: Sets min power (dBm) of 5Ghz band. Can be integer between 2 and 30. Defaults to 8.

rxsop.description: The RX-SOP level controls the sensitivity of the radio. It is strongly recommended to use RX-SOP only after consulting a wireless expert. RX-SOP can be configured in the range of -65 to -95 (dBm). A value of null will reset this to the default.

minBitrateType.description: Minimum bitrate can be set to either 'band' or 'ssid'. Defaults to band.

name.description: The name of the new profile. Must be unique. This param is required on creation.

bandSteeringEnabled.description: Steers client to most open band between 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz. Can be either true or false.

minBitrate.description: Sets min bitrate (Mbps) of this SSID. Can be one of '1', '2', '5.5', '6', '9', '11', '12', '18', '24', '36', '48' or '54'.

enabled.description: Toggle for radio transmission. When false, radios will not transmit at all.

axEnabled.description: Determines whether ax radio on 2.4Ghz band is on or off. Can be either true or false. If false, we highly recommend disabling band steering. Defaults to true.

maxPower.description: Sets max power (dBm) of 2.4Ghz band. Can be integer between 2 and 30. Defaults to 30.

minBitrate.description: Sets min bitrate (Mbps) of 2.4Ghz band. Can be one of '1', '2', '5.5', '6', '9', '11', '12', '18', '24', '36', '48' or '54'. Defaults to 11.

minPower.description: Sets min power (dBm) of 2.4Ghz band. Can be integer between 2 and 30. Defaults to 5.

rxsop.description: The RX-SOP level controls the sensitivity of the radio. It is strongly recommended to use RX-SOP only after consulting a wireless expert. RX-SOP can be configured in the range of -65 to -95 (dBm). A value of null will reset this to the default.

validAutoChannels.description: Sets valid auto channels for 2.4Ghz band. Can be one of '1', '6' or '11'. Defaults to [1, 6, 11].

$ul: **apBandSettings**: Settings that will be enabled if selectionType is set to 'ap'.
**bandOperationMode**: Choice between 'dual', '2.4ghz' or '5ghz'. Defaults to dual.
**bandSteeringEnabled**: Steers client to most open band. Can be either true or false. Defaults to true.
**bandSelectionType**: Band selection can be set to either 'ssid' or 'ap'. This param is required on creation.
**clientBalancingEnabled**: Steers client to best available access point. Can be either true or false. Defaults to true.
**fiveGhzSettings**: Settings related to 5Ghz band
**channelWidth**: Sets channel width (MHz) for 5Ghz band. Can be one of 'auto', '20', '40' or '80'. Defaults to auto.
**maxPower**: Sets max power (dBm) of 5Ghz band. Can be integer between 2 and 30. Defaults to 30.
**minBitrate**: Sets min bitrate (Mbps) of 5Ghz band. Can be one of '6', '9', '12', '18', '24', '36', '48' or '54'. Defaults to 12.
**minPower**: Sets min power (dBm) of 5Ghz band. Can be integer between 2 and 30. Defaults to 8.

**rxsop**: The RX-SOP level controls the sensitivity of the radio. It is strongly recommended to use RX-SOP only after consulting a wireless expert. RX-SOP can be configured in the range of -65 to -95 (dBm). A value of null will reset this to the default.
**id**: The name of the new profile. Must be unique.
**minBitrateType**: Minimum bitrate can be set to either 'band' or 'ssid'. Defaults to band.
**name**: The name of the new profile. Must be unique. This param is required on creation.
**networkId**: The network ID of the RF Profile
**perSsidSettings**: Per-SSID radio settings by number.
**0**: Settings for SSID 0
**bandOperationMode**: Choice between 'dual', '2.4ghz' or '5ghz'.
**bandSteeringEnabled**: Steers client to most open band between 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz. Can be either true or false.
**minBitrate**: Sets min bitrate (Mbps) of this SSID. Can be one of '1', '2', '5.5', '6', '9', '11', '12', '18', '24', '36', '48' or '54'.
**name**: Name of SSID
**1**: Settings for SSID 1
**bandOperationMode**: Choice between 'dual', '2.4ghz' or '5ghz'.

**minBitrate**: Sets min bitrate (Mbps) of this SSID. Can be one of '1', '2', '5.5', '6', '9', '11', '12', '18', '24', '36', '48' or '54'.
**name**: Name of SSID

**bandSteeringEnabled**: Steers client to most open band between 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz. Can be either true or false.
**minBitrate**: Sets min bitrate (Mbps) of this SSID. Can be one of '1', '2', '5.5', '6', '9', '11', '12', '18', '24', '36', '48' or '54'.

**bandOperationMode**: Choice between 'dual', '2.4ghz' or '5ghz'.
**bandSteeringEnabled**: Steers client to most open band between 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz. Can be either true or false.
**minBitrate**: Sets min bitrate (Mbps) of this SSID. Can be one of '1', '2', '5.5', '6', '9', '11', '12', '18', '24', '36', '48' or '54'.
**name**: Name of SSID
**12**: Settings for SSID 12
**bandOperationMode**: Choice between 'dual', '2.4ghz' or '5ghz'.
**bandSteeringEnabled**: Steers client to most open band between 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz. Can be either true or false.
**minBitrate**: Sets min bitrate (Mbps) of this SSID. Can be one of '1', '2', '5.5', '6', '9', '11', '12', '18', '24', '36', '48' or '54'.

**bandOperationMode**: Choice between 'dual', '2.4ghz' or '5ghz'.
**bandSteeringEnabled**: Steers client to most open band between 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz. Can be either true or false.
**minBitrate**: Sets min bitrate (Mbps) of this SSID. Can be one of '1', '2', '5.5', '6', '9', '11', '12', '18', '24', '36', '48' or '54'.
**name**: Name of SSID
**14**: Settings for SSID 14
**bandOperationMode**: Choice between 'dual', '2.4ghz' or '5ghz'.
**bandSteeringEnabled**: Steers client to most open band between 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz. Can be either true or false.
**minBitrate**: Sets min bitrate (Mbps) of this SSID. Can be one of '1', '2', '5.5', '6', '9', '11', '12', '18', '24', '36', '48' or '54'.
**name**: Name of SSID
**transmission**: Settings related to radio transmission.
**enabled**: Toggle for radio transmission. When false, radios will not transmit at all.
**twoFourGhzSettings**: Settings related to 2.4Ghz band
**axEnabled**: Determines whether ax radio on 2.4Ghz band is on or off. Can be either true or false. If false, we highly recommend disabling band steering. Defaults to true.
**maxPower**: Sets max power (dBm) of 2.4Ghz band. Can be integer between 2 and 30. Defaults to 30.
**minBitrate**: Sets min bitrate (Mbps) of 2.4Ghz band. Can be one of '1', '2', '5.5', '6', '9', '11', '12', '18', '24', '36', '48' or '54'. Defaults to 11.
**minPower**: Sets min power (dBm) of 2.4Ghz band. Can be integer between 2 and 30. Defaults to 5.

**rxsop**: The RX-SOP level controls the sensitivity of the radio. It is strongly recommended to use RX-SOP only after consulting a wireless expert. RX-SOP can be configured in the range of -65 to -95 (dBm). A value of null will reset this to the default.
**validAutoChannels**: Sets valid auto channels for 2.4Ghz band. Can be one of '1', '6' or '11'. Defaults to [1, 6, 11].
